message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of segmenting unseen object instances in tabletop environments using synthetic data. This problem is closely related to computer vision (cs.CV) and robotics (cs.RO) as it involves object recognition and manipulation. The paper proposes a novel method that uses both RGB and depth data, which requires machine learning techniques such as artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper also discusses the application of the proposed method for robot grasping, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.GR).
